intro.title: Why is the Bible So Important?
intro.description: The Bible is not just one more book on moral codes, self-help, or a healthy lifestyle. It has a message that is urgent for all those who wish to live forever. The content of the Bible is not only to restore human beings on this Earth, but to teach them the way to eternity.

appendix.appendixContent:
Galatians 5:22-23

22 But the fruit of the Spirit is love, joy, peace, longsuffering, kindness, goodness, faithfulness,23 gentleness, self-control. Against such there is no law.

questions.description: Jesus went straight to the point when He said that we should examine the Scriptures because in them we would find eternal life (John 5:39 and Isaiah 45:22). What did Jesus mean by that? That we are all lost and that the Bible is the only safe guide for us to find the message that He died for us and that by faith we can have hope for eternity (Romans 5:18). This is the message that makes the Bible the most important book in the world! Eternity serves as a balm for those who suffer. However, even before reaching it, Christ’s followers have the opportunity to live a better life, based on the fruits of the Spirit (Galatians 5:22-23).
questions.questionTitle: About the importance of the Bible, consider the statements below.
questions.questionVersicles: Read John 5:39, Isaiah 45:22, and Romans 5:18 and mark true (T) or false (F):

answers.text: It teaches the way for eternity
It is where we can find eternal life
It can only be used as a moral code
The Bible teaches that through faith we can hope for eternity

appendix.appendixContent:
Deuteronomy 17:18-20

18 “Also it shall be, when he sits on the throne of his kingdom, that he shall write for himself a copy of this law in a book, from the one before the priests, the Levites.19 And it shall be with him, and he shall read it all the days of his life, that he may learn to fear the Lord his God and be careful to observe all the words of this law and these statutes,20 that his heart may not be lifted above his brethren, that he may not turn aside from the commandment to the right hand or to the left, and that he may prolong his days in his kingdom, he and his children in the midst of Israel.

Galatians 5:19-23

19 Now the works of the flesh are evident, which are: adultery, fornication, uncleanness, lewdness,20 idolatry, sorcery, hatred, contentions, jealousies, outbursts of wrath, selfish ambitions, dissensions, heresies,21 envy, murders, drunkenness, revelries, and the like; of which I tell you beforehand, just as I also told you in time past, that those who practice such things will not inherit the kingdom of God.22 But the fruit of the Spirit is love, joy, peace, longsuffering, kindness, goodness, faithfulness,23 gentleness, self-control. Against such there is no law.

questions.description: Along with the message of salvation, we can also add the fact that the Bible proposes a new way of life for those who have accepted Jesus as their Savior. They begin a life of balance, peace, altruism, and other characteristics (Deuteronomy 17:18-20 and Galatians 5:19-23).
